title: Jeremy Kyle 'suicide' guest family demand show hand over unseen footage
text:

Jeremy Kyle guest Stephen Dymond's family have demanded ITV hand unseen footage of him on the show after he fatally overdosed.

They want ITV to hand over all of their correspondence with Dymond before and after the show was filmed, as well as the entire footage from the episode.

The family are gathering evidence on the case ahead of the inquest on Dymond's death next month, and it will be up to the coroner to decide what is relevant.

The hearing will discuss the role of the show in Dymond's death.

(Image: Steve Dymond Facebook)

It has been reported he struggled to deal with the repercussions of failing the love cheat 'lie detector' result from the episode he filmed, which never aired.

His friend Michael Bradbury said that Dymond had contacted the show himself because he was convinced it would quell his fiance Jane Callaghan's fears that he cheated.

When he failed the 'lie detector', he insisted the results were incorrect - but Jane kicked him out of the house.

The 63-year-old died just ten days after filming, and the show was abruptly taken off air. ITV later confirmed it was cancelled.

Dymond's family applied for legal aid for the inquest on the grounds that his death requires an Article 2 inquest and that there is significant wider public interest in the inquest, given its links to a well-watched TV show and the care provided to participants in reality television generally - but their application was denied.

(Image: Facebook)

Merry Varney, solicitor for the family from law firm Leigh Day, said: “It is disgraceful that Stephen’s family are having to fight for legal aid in this inquest.

"As well as dealing with their grief, we believe they have been subjected to flawed decision making by the Legal Aid Agency".

They added: "Stephen’s family strongly believe that there is a wider public interest in his inquest given the prevalence on reality television in today’s society and the other reported deaths that have been linked to reality television participants.”

The construction worker was found dead in his bedroom in Portsmouth on 9th May, shortly after splitting from Jane, Portsmouth Coroner's Court heard.

(Image: ITV)

Hampshire Police Detective Sergeant Marcus Mills told the inquest that Dymond was living in the property of a pair called Michelle and Sam, and had moved in on 10th February.

He said: "Steven had told Michelle and Sam he had been in a relationship with a female named Jane.

"They had split up and he had been kicked out of the house following allegations he had been cheating.

"Steven had also mentioned they were going to go on the Jeremy Kyle show for a lie detector test to get everything sorted.

(Image: PA)

"Steven told Michelle that things didn't go well on the show.

"He became angry when talking about Jane. He became concerned about the repercussions of the show and the rumours that had started as a result."

Dymond had recently been in touch with estranged son Carl and discovered he was a grandfather, the hearing was told.

Two letters, one addressed to Carl and the other to Ms Callaghan, were discovered near his body alongside medication packets, DS Mills said.

He added: "There were no signs of foul play from any other parties. This was a suspected suicide."
description: Stephen Dymond's family are demanding ITV hand over all the evidence relating to his appearance on the Jeremy Kyle Show
